content.webTitle: Film picks: Rocky Balboa | Babel | Y Tu Mamá También

fields.headline: Film picks
fields.bodyText: Rocky Balboa 4.05pm & 10pm, Sky Movies Action Thriller (Sylvester Stallone, 2006) Stallone may have been 60, but that didn't stop his unfeasibly musclebound heavyweight, now a widowed restaurant owner, coming out of retirement for a sixth beefy and emotional bout. This time he's up against reigning champion Mason Dixon (Antonio Tarver): cue the traditional training montage before a brutal confrontation in the ring. Babel 7.35pm & 12.10am, Sky Movies Indie (Alejandro González Iñárritu, 2006) A rifle is fired in Morocco, and the shockwaves reverberate through several families: Brad Pitt and Cate Blanchett are the middle-class American tourists at the centre of the storm, when the latter is badly wounded by the random bullet. The contrived plotting is hard to swallow, but it's a powerful drama that evokes a sense of the human condition. Y Tu Mamá También 11.25pm, Film4 (Alfonso Cuarón, 2001) Julio and Tenoch are 17 and amazed when beautiful, unhappy young wife Luisa (Maribel Verdú) accepts their invitation to head out of Mexico City in search of a legendary beach. As the buddies (beautifully played by Gael García Bernal and Diego Luna) become rivals in machismo for Luisa, their rite-of-passage slides into melancholy shadows.
